intro: Uncinia scabriuscula, commonly known as the rough brittlestem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with grayish-green, rough-textured leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Uncinia scabriuscula thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands.
